indications: Indications see notes above and product literature
name: THYROTROPIN ALFA
breadcrumbs: 6.5 Hypothalamic and pituitary hormones and anti-oestrogens
6.5.1 Hypothalamic and anterior pituitary hormones and anti-oestrogens
cautions:
Cautions presence of thyroglobulin autoantibodies
may give false negative results
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting; headache, dizziness, fatigue; less commonly asthenia, paraesthesia, back pain, influenza-like
symptoms, rash, urticaria; rarely diarrhoea; very rarely palpitation, flushing, dyspnoea, pain at site
of metastases, tremor, arthralgia, myalgia, hyperhidrosis, and injection-site
reactions including pain, pruritus, and rash
doses:
By intramuscular injection into the gluteal
muscle, 900 micrograms every 24 hours for 2 doses, consult product
literature
